title: Two A's and how many F's?! Midseason grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: From the contenders acing 2025 to the first-half failures, we take a look at every club's performance.

title: Trade proposals for Paul Skenes, Ronald Acuña Jr., Byron Buxton
content: You won't see these stars available via trade this year -- but what would it take to land them if they were?

title: OKC's Holmgren agrees to rookie max extension
content: Thunder star Chet Holmgren has agreed to a fully guaranteed five-year maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $250 million, Bill Duffy of WME Basketball told ESPN on Wednesday morning.

title: Sources: Bucs star Wirfs to miss start of season
content: Buccaneers star left tackle Tristan Wirfs is expected to miss the start of the regular season because of a knee injury, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Bencic in Wimbledon semis year after giving birth
content: Belinda Bencic, playing in her first Wimbledon quarterfinal in nine appearances at the All England Club, upset Russian teen sensation Mirra Andreeva 7-6 (3), 7-6 (2) on Wednesday to reach her second Grand Slam semifinal and first in six years.

title: Ancelotti gets 1-year sentence in tax fraud case
content: A Madrid court on Wednesday handed down a one-year sentence and a €386,000 ($452,000) fine to Brazil coach Carlo Ancelotti for failing to pay tax on his image rights revenues when he was Real Madrid manager in 2014, the court said in a statement.

title: Bailey's inside-the-park, walk-off HR 1st since '16
content: Patrick Bailey hit a three-run, inside-the-park home run with one out in the ninth inning, lifting the Giants over the Phillies on Tuesday night.

title: Clark, Collier draft All-Star teams, flip coaches
content: Caitlin Clark selected her two Indiana All-Star teammates in the draft to determine teams for the WNBA All-Star Game on July 19.

title: Ohtani takes Miz deep but phenom fans 12 in win
content: Shohei Ohtani greeted Jacob Misiorowski with a 431-foot leadoff homer Tuesday night, but the Milwaukee Brewers rookie phenom got the last laugh with a 12-strikeout night.

title: Horner sacked as Red Bull chief, team confirms
content: Christian Horner has been sacked by Red Bull after 20 years as team principal, the team confirmed on Wednesday.

title: The extraordinary mystery of the Tigers' Tarik Skubal
content: "I wasn't good until I was 26," the All-Star pitcher says. How he rose from Little League lore to Cy Young.

title: Who are the NFL's best edge rushers? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Who are the best edge rushers in the NFL? Execs, coaches and scouts ranked their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: Assembling the 2028 Olympic roster for U.S. flag football: Our 10-player roster -- and one go-to play
content: We picked nine NFL players -- and one college football star -- for the U.S. Olympic flag football roster for 2028. Who would make our team?

title: All of college football ought to cheer for Texas Tech
content: The Red Raiders' signing of Felix Ojo shows the college football playing field is continuing to level.

title: Why Mbappé, PSG reunion at Club World Cup will be must-see TV
content: Kylian Mbappé will meet his former club, PSG, on Wednesday in the Club World Cup semifinal. It'll be a fascinating reunion for many reasons, not least because of how PSG have grown without him.

title: Power Rankings: Storm up, Aces down and no time to panic for New York
content: The defending champ opened the season with nine straight wins. But it has lost six of the past nine games.

title: New East tiers: How injuries, offseason movement reshaped the conference
content: From injured superstars to play-in teams making major splashes, Chris Herring runs down every team's outlook for 2025-26.

title: Can No. 1 Sabalenka be defeated? Amanda Anisimova may find a way
content: The Wimbledon semifinal between top-ranked Sabalenka and American Anisimova might not be as straightforward as it seems. We break it down.

title: Inside the shift in evaluating MLB draft catching prospects
content: MLB's 2023 rules changes are influencing how the position is taught, played, coached, scouted at all levels.

title: Ranking all 32 NFL teams based on WR, RB and TE talent: Who's No. 1? Who's No. 32?
content: Which teams have the best skill position talent around their quarterback? We stacked all 32 from worst to first.

title: Club World Cup's standout players and trends, from Jobe Bellingham to Thiago Silva
content: From stifling heat to standout players, let's talk about the Club World Cup's most memorable so far in Gianni Infantino's grand, weird experiment.

title: Can the Taylor-Serrano 3 card create the next rivalries in women's boxing?
content: With Katie Taylor-Amanda Serrano 3 headlining an all-women's card on Netflix, could the sport surge in popularity?

title: Gyökeres: Amorim's tactics 'suited me perfectly'
content: Sporting CP forward Viktor Gyökeres has said the style of play under his former coach Ruben Amorim "suited me perfectly."

title: Teams can 'win' home advantage in UCL
content: UEFA's decision means teams that finish between third and sixth in the league phase cannot get home priority in the Champions League semifinals.

title: MPs approve Premier League, EFL regulator
content: MPs voted in favour of establishing a professional football regulator under a "Football Governance Bill" that would see clubs handed operating licences.

title: Caicedo suffers late ankle injury in Chelsea win
content: Chelsea midfielder Moisés Caicedo hurt his left ankle during second-half injury time in Tuesday's 2-0 win over Fluminense in the semifinals of the Club World Cup.

title: Chelsea's Pedro 'sorry' to knock out boyhood club
content: João Pedro kept the celebrations to a minimum after scoring twice to send Chelsea into the Club World Cup final, his goals proving the undoing of his former club Fluminense in a bittersweet meeting at MetLife Stadium on Tuesday.

title: Luis Enrique on Mbappé: Not discussing the 'past'
content: PSG coach Luis Enrique refused to discuss Kylian Mbappé ahead of Wednesday's Club World Cup semifinal with his former star's new club Real Madrid.

title: Police: Speeding could be factor in Jota crash
content: Spanish police believe Liverpool player Diogo Jota was driving over the speed limit when he and his brother died in a car crash last week.

title: United confirm Cunha as new No. 10 after Rashford
content: New Manchester United signing Matheus Cunha will wear the No. 10 shirt previously worn by Marcus Rashford, the Premier League club confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Texas Tech's tortillas and more updates to CFB 26 are shown through team accounts
content: New traditions, presentation features and uniforms have been added to the second edition of the game.

title: Wrexham unveil 2025-26 home kit: Will they reach the Premier League with it?
content: Wrexham will have a fresh look when they return to English football's second tier after 43 years away.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Spurs in four-way battle for Dibling
content: Manchester United are in a four-way battle to sign Southampton's Tyler Dibling. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: On Arvind Kejriwal's "Nobel Prize" Remark, BJP's "Check Mental Health" Jibe
content: Aam Aadmi Party national convenor Arvind Kejriwal, while defending his tenure as Delhi Chief Minister, said he deserved a Nobel Prize for governance. Delhi BJP responded sharply with a jibe, calling the comment delusional.

title: Bye-Bye Frosty Ties? 2 Decades After Singur, Mamata Banerjee, Tata Chief Meet
content: For the first time since she became chief minister in 2011, Mamata Banerjee met Tata Sons and Tata Motors chairman N Chandrasekaran in Kolkata on Wednesday.

title: Farewell Elephant Vatsala: A Century Of Grace Ends In Panna Tiger Reserve
content: In the stillness of the forest, where the chirping of birds once mingled with her measured footsteps, a void now echoes. Vatsala, the beloved matriarch of Panna Tiger Reserve, passed away on Wednesday at over 100 years old leaving behind a profound s

title: Out On Morning Walk, Arunachal Ex MLA Trampled To Death By Wild Elephant
content: A morning walk took a tragic turn for former MLA Kapchen Rajkumar who was trampled to death in an elephant attack on Wednesday while heading from Deomali to Namsang village in Arunachal Pradesh.

title: Lives Lost, Now Time Too: Gujarat Bridge Collapse Will Cause 50-km Detour
content: People will have to travel an extra 50 km as a key Gujarat bridge, connecting Anand and Vadodara districts, collapsed on Wednesday morning killing 11 people.

title: Girls Told To Strip For Period Check After Blood Stains Found In School Bathroom
content: Girls in a Maharashtra school, between classes 5 and 10, were forced to strip and examined by teachers after blood stains were found in the bathroom, sparking anger among parents, said the police.

title: Pre-Historic Caves, Forests Among Sites Vying For UNESCO Heritage Spot
content: The United Nation's cultural organisation announces its choice of sites for inclusion in its world heritage list this week, with pre-historic caves, former centres of repression, forests, marine bio-systems and others vying for the coveted spots.

title: Minister's Jhansi Ki Rani Jibe At Kangana Ranaut Over Mandi Rain Disaster
content: Himachal Pradesh is badly hit by heavy rain and flash floods, killing 78 people and damaging property worth Rs 400 crore, and the Mandi district - the Parliamentary constituency of BJP's Kangana Ranaut - was the worst hit with over 15 deaths.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink Gets Green Light From Indian Space Regulator
content: In what could change the future of affordable satellite-based internet service in India, Elon Musk's Starlink on Wednesday received approval from the country's space regulator, the Indian National Space Promotion and Authorisation Centre (IN-SPACe).

title: Trump Admin To Subpoena Harvard For Information On Foreign Students
content: The Trump administration escalated its feud with Harvard University on Wednesday, saying the Department of Homeland Security planned to issue subpoenas for information about alleged misconduct by foreign students.

title: D Fadnavis' Strong Response To MLA's Slap Video, E Shinde Left Red-Faced
content: The viral video of a Shiv Sena MLA assaulting a canteen staff over the quality of food came up in the Maharashtra Council today. Responding to the Opposition's questions, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said such conduct by an MLA is not right

title: 70 Security Volunteers Killed In Nigeria In Ambush By Bandits
content: Bandits killed at least 70 community security volunteers in an ambush in violence-ridden Plateau state in central Nigeria, residents and a volunteer leader said on Wednesday.

title: 106 Crores In 40 Accounts: Conversion Gang Mastermind Chhangur Baba's Empire
content: Jamaluddin alias Chhangur Baba - the mastermind of a religious conversion gang - once used to sell rings and amulets on his bicycle.

title: Rain Fury Has Caused Rs 800-Crore Loss In Himachal: Chief Minister To NDTV
content: Rain fury in Himachal Pradesh has caused a loss of nearly Rs 800 crore and every family that has lost their house will receive a compensation of Rs 7 lakh, Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has said.

title: Spain PM Announces Anti-Graft Plan As Scandal Rocks Government
content: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez on Wednesday announced an anti-corruption plan designed with the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development in a bid to salvage confidence in his scandal-hit government.

title: 11 Killed After Bridge Collapses In Gujarat: A Look Back At Major Tragedies
content: 11 people were killed and three others injured on Wednesday morning when a portion of the Gambhira-Mujpur bridge collapsed in Gujarat's Vadodara district, sending multiple vehicles into the Mahisagar (Mahi) River.

title: 11 Killed After Vehicles Fall Into River As Bridge Collapses In Gujarat
content: 11 people were killed and several vehicles fell into the Mahisagar (Mahi) River after a section of the Gambhira-Mujpur bridge in Padra taluka of Gujarat's Vadodara collapsed on Wednesday.

title: Gujarat Bridge That Fell Shook When Cars Crossed, Was Disaster-In-Waiting
content: Fisherman Narendra Mali was at work this morning at the Mahisagar river, close to the Gambhira bridge that connects Gujarat's Vadodara and Anand districts. He was looking for the day's catch when he and his companions heard noises

title: PM Modi Conferred With Namibia's Highest Civilian Award During First Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Wednesday conferred with Namibia's highest civilian award, 'Order of the Most Ancient Welwitschia Mirabilis'.

title: Shashi Tharoor Shares Survey In Which He Tops Kerala Chief Minister Poll
content: Amid an uneasy equation with the Congress high command, senior leader and Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor appears to have received a significant boost from a pre-poll survey conducted by Mumbai-based VoteVibe.

title: Electoral Registration Officers hold the key to inclusion in Bihar voter roll in the absence of requisite documents for SIR
content: EROs empowered to take a call in such cases, based on field verification, BLO reports, testimonials of village heads, families; as State officials, ERO verdicts may be influenced by ruling party, warns Opposition

title: India plays key role in bringing out FATF’s latest report on terrorist financing risks
content: India’s 2022 National Risk Assessment (NRA) on money laundering and terror financing flagged state-sponsored terrorism — particularly from Pakistan — as a major concern, says government official

title: Bengaluru too hot? Dramatic increase in built-up area to blame, says study
content: 15.41 sq. km area in the city has very high temperature, only 168.93 sq. km area was under favourable conditions as per the Urban Thermal Field Variance Index, shows study (Map of built-up area comparison mailed)

title: Hundreds of migrant workers from West Bengal held in Odisha: Trinamool
content: West Bengal Chief Secretary has written to his Odisha counterpart, urging immediate intervention and verification of the detained workers’ Indian citizenship

title: Will go to Erravelli farm house to debate on river water issue: Revanth
content: Chief Minister vows to fight for the rights of Telangana, promises not to bow to any forces in its fight against securing the rightful share of river water for the State

title: Over 25 crore workers joined the strike, claim trade unions
content: Leaders of central trade unions say key sectors such as power, mines, minerals, coal, ports and public transport were affected; they claim it was a bandh-like situation in Puducherry, Assam, Bihar, Jharkhand, Tamil Nadu, Punjab, Kerala, West Bengal, Odisha, Karnataka, Goa, Meghalaya, Manipur

title: Pakistan-based terror handler’s properties seized in Kashmir: J&K Police
content: The land belonging to the accused at Peer Mohalla Chandigam was attached under provisions of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act

title: Fee for engineering, architecture courses in private unaided colleges up by 7.5%, govt. colleges by 5%
content: The State government has announced a 50% fee waiver for five engineering courses, namely civil, mechanical, automobile, textile technology, and silk technology, which are seeing fewer takers

title: Two science teachers held for running clandestine drugs lab in Rajasthan
content: The NCB’s searches at an apartment in a residential complex in Sriganganagar led to the seizure of 780 gm of Mephedrone, valued at crores of rupees in the international market

title: Prime suspect in Hemachandran murder case  arrested from Bengaluru airport
content: The police had initiated legal measures for his speedy extradition from Saudi Arabia, apart from issuing a lookout circular

title: India gets its first indigenously designed and built Diving Support Vessel in INS Nistar
content: The ship is highly specialised and can undertake Deep Sea Diving and Rescue Operations, the Navy says

title: Mamata Banerjee meets Tata Motors chairperson Natarajan Chandrasekaran
content: This marks a significant development following the long turbulent relations between the two entities, which culminated in the Tata Nano car factory relocating from the State in 2008

title: KEAM results: higher secondary teachers’ outfits slam government
content: Failure to examine mark normalisation issue in a time-bound manner, take a studied decision, and make necessary changes to the prospectus has resulted in the quashing of the KEAM exam results, according to teachers’ outfits

title: Scouting the season's second-half schedule for surprises
content: Let's take a closer look at the second-half schedule to see if some teams have players to grab -- or to be avoided.

title: ASI allows Sriraman to prepare report on Keeladi excavations
content: Sriraman, who retired in 2019, will write reports on the third phase of excavations at Keeladi and one season of excavations at Kodumanal

title: Centre will consider and fulfil Bihar’s demands at the earliest, says Kamlesh Paswan
content: The survey for the construction of 45,000 km of rural roads under the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana, estimated at a cost of ₹76,000 crore, was currently underway, the Union Minister of State for Rural Development said

title: CPI(M), BJP workers clash in Pathanamthitta
content: Among the injured, two are CPI(M) workers. All are currently undergoing treatment at the Pathanamthitta General Hospital

title: LSGD formulates policy on Extended Producer Responsibility for handling non-biodegradable waste
content: The policy aims at reducing waste burden on local bodies by incentivising producers to reduce waste and to invest in recycling initiatives

title: Digital University Kerala comes under scanner over suspicion of financial irregularities; V-C urges Chancellor to initiate audit
content: V-C flags misuse of government funds, unauthorised private ventures by faculty, and irregularities in high-profile projects, particularly the flagship ‘Graphene-Aurora programme’

title: Need for coordination between TUDA and panchayats stressed
content: TUDA Chairman explains advantages of having authorised layouts and approved buildings in the panchayats during a training programme for panchayat secretaries and MPDOs

title: KDA sub-committee to look into why many students fail in Kannada in SSLC
content: SEP likely to recommend two-language policy, but implementation will be tough for govt., says Bilimale

title: CBFC reiterates demand to rename film JSK, production firm agrees to demand
content: Board’s affidavit says the petition filed by the film production company fails to appreciate that films are evaluated in their entirety, rather than in isolation

title: Supreme Court Bench headed by Justice Dhulia to hear Bihar electoral roll revision case on July 10
content: Court has listed over 10 petitions by Opposition leaders, activists, NGOs and lawyers, and also one in favour of the exercise

title: Resettlement plan for violence-displaced unclear: Manipur Congress chief
content: Keisham Meghachandra says the State government is merely transferring the IDPs from relief camps to prefabricated units, not facilitating their return to homes

title: Hundreds take out march, stage protest in several districts as part of nation-wide strike
content: Members of various trade unions take part in the protest marches in various district headquarters and major towns and cities

title: Over 2 crore to participate in Mega PTM 2.0 event in A.P.
content: The programme will be conducted in 61,000 educational institutions, including government, aided, unaided schools, and junior colleges

title: BJP questions Opposition’s motive behind ‘Bihar bandh’ call
content: MP Ravi Shankar Prasad questions if this was a means to pressure the judiciary, given that the matter was scheduled for hearing on July 10, 2025

title: Shrinking patronage forces private bus operators to desist from seeking fare revision in Kerala
content: Private bus strike conducted on Tuesday had not demanded any minimum fare revision, although many media houses quoted the demands incorrectly, says Joint Committee of Bus Owners

title: Pathanamthitta district administration to examine allegations against quarry’s operations
content: Orders issued to halt the operation of Chenkulam quarry at Payyanamon, where two persons were killed in an accident

title: India Post mulls dedicated cargo space on airlines for faster deliveries
content: Department explores “hard blocking” of air cargo space; road transport gains traction with highway upgrades

title: Government committed to protecting interests of mango farmers, says A.P. Transport Minister
content: Letters have been addressed to the Centre requesting ₹130 crore under the Market Intervention Scheme, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: PM Modi conferred with Namibia's highest civilian award
content: Prime Minister Modi receives Namibia’s highest civilian award during his first visit, strengthening bilateral cooperation

title: A.P. Cabinet nod for Quantum Computing Centre in Amaravati, Bulk Drug Park expansion at Nakkapalli
content: Andhra Pradesh Space Policy 2025–30 approved; proposal to provide shortfall guarantee to A.P. Airports Development Corporation Limited cleared, says Minister

title: Jharkhand HC admits CBI appeal for increasing sentence of RJD chief Lalu Prasad in Deoghar scam
content: Investigation had revealed that he was aware of the defalcation in the Deoghar treasury. Yet the lower court only awarded a sentence of 3.5 years for the offence, which carries a maximum sentence of seven years, it said.

title: Ganesh Kumar’s ‘anti-strike’ stance draws criticism from within the LDF
content: Communist Party of India (CPI) State Secretary Binoy Viswam says the Transport Minister, a Kerala Congress (B) leader and LDF ally, should have towed the Left trade union line on the national strike for workers’ rights. CPI(M)] leader A.K. Balan says the Minister should have refrained from appearing hostile to the workers’ cause

title: 'Use lethal weapons': Leaked audio suggests Hasina gave 'shoot' orders; authorised crackdown
content: A leaked audio recording allegedly reveals former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina ordering a deadly crackdown on protesters in 2024, instructing security forces to use lethal weapons. The Awami League denies the allegations, attributing the violence to undisciplined security forces. Hasina, facing trial in absentia for crimes against humanity, left Bangladesh as protests intensified, resulting in an estimated 1,400 deaths.

title: Trump fires new tariff salvo! Iraq, Philippines & others to face up to 30% duties
content: Donald Trump issued tariff letters to several countries, including the Philippines, Brunei, Moldova, Algeria, Libya, and Iraq, warning of reciprocal duties starting August 1, 2025. These actions follow Trump's earlier announcement of tariffs for fourteen other nations.

title: Fan frenzy for Vaibhav Suryavanshi: Two girls drive 6 hours to meet him
content: India's Under-19 cricket sensation, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, is capturing hearts both on and off the field. Before the Youth Test series, two young fans traveled six hours to meet him, sporting his IPL team's jerseys. Despite a loss in the final ODI where Vaibhav scored a gritty 33, his earlier century and fan interactions highlight his rising popularity.

title: 'Modi, Modi' chants in Namibian parliament: PM receives standing ovation after his address
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed the Namibian parliament, highlighting the historical ties and shared democratic values between India and Namibia. He acknowledged Namibia's support by sending cheetahs to India and India's support during Namibia's independence movement. Modi emphasised India's commitment to Namibia's development goals, referencing Vision 2030 and the Harambee Prosperity Plan, while celebrating the election of Namibia's first woman president.

title: Masterplan! Three things India must do to crush England at Lord's
content: Ahead of the crucial third Test at Lord's, Deep Dasgupta emphasizes the need for Team India to maintain consistency in both batting and bowling, mirroring their Edgbaston performance. He highlights the importance of rest and recovery, especially for the pace bowlers and captain Shubman Gill, given the short turnaround.

title: Elon Musk reacts as Bill Gates again raises alarm on USAID funding cut killing children
content: Bill Gates expressed concerns over potential health aid cuts by the US government, warning of increased deaths. Elon Musk responded sharply, suggesting Gates' unhappiness stemmed from his organization losing US taxpayer funding. This exchange is the latest in a series of disagreements, fueled by Gates' past short position against Tesla stock, which reportedly cost him $1.5 billion.

title: Tharoor eyeing CM post? Cong MP shares survey naming him front-runner for UDF
content: Shashi Tharoor, a Congress MP, has shared a survey projecting him as the leading candidate for Kerala's Chief Minister from the UDF. The Vote Vibe survey indicates strong anti-incumbency and shows Tharoor preferred by 28.3% of respondents. Amid strained relations with Congress leadership, Tharoor's public statements and invitations from PM Modi have caused discomfort within the Kerala unit.

title: Gujarat bridge collapse: Death toll rises to 13; rescue operations continue
content: In Gujarat's Vadodara district, a section of the Gambhira Bridge collapsed, causing a truck, van, and car to fall into the Mahisagar River. Rescue teams are working at the site, with ten fatalities confirmed and nine individuals hospitalised with injuries. Prime Minister Modi has offered condolences and announced financial assistance for the victims' families.

title: Nvidia does what Apple and Microsoft has not been able to as yet
content: Nvidia has achieved a $4 trillion market capitalization, becoming the first public company to reach this milestone, driven by soaring demand for its AI chips. This surge has propelled Nvidia's stock, making it a dominant force in the S&P 500. As trade tensions ease and AI adoption accelerates, Nvidia's leadership position in the tech sector is further solidified.

title: Snubbed? Security stops Pappu Yadav, Kanhaiya from entering Rahul, Tejashwi’s van - Watch
content: During Wednesday's Bihar Bandh protest against the Election Commission's electoral roll revision, Congress leaders Kanhaiya Kumar and Pappu Yadav were seemingly prevented from boarding a vehicle carrying Rahul Gandhi and other INDIA bloc leaders.

title: X CEO Linda Yaccarino steps down after two years
content: Linda Yaccarino has stepped down from her role as CEO of Twitter. She served for two years after Elon Musk acquired the platform. Yaccarino expressed gratitude to Musk for the opportunity. She was tasked with stabilizing the ad business and enhancing user safety. During her tenure, Twitter introduced features like Community Notes and X Money.

title: Shardul Thakur touches Bumrah's feet, says 'pair padne padte hai'
content: Jasprit Bumrah is set to rejoin the Indian squad for the highly anticipated third Test against England at Lord's. After being rested, Bumrah was seen bowling with full intensity in the nets. He also shared a light moment with Shardul 'Lord' Thakur, as captured in a video shared by the BCCI.

title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7, Flip 7 and Flip 7 FE price in India announced
content: Samsung has introduced its new foldable smartphones in India. The lineup includes Galaxy Z Fold7, Galaxy Z Flip7, and Galaxy Z Flip7 FE. The Galaxy Z Fold7 starts at Rs 1,74,999. The Galaxy Z Flip7 begins at Rs 1,09,999. The more affordable Galaxy Z Flip7 FE is priced from Rs 89,999.

title: 'Doesn't send right message': Fadnavis reacts strongly to Sena MLA slap video
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has denounced Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad for assaulting canteen workers at the Akashwani MLA hostel in Mumbai. Fadnavis said that such behaviour sends the wrong message, after a video went viral showing Gaikwad slapping and punching an employee. Gaikwad alleges he was served stale food and that repeated complaints about the canteen's poor quality, including claims of rodents and unsanitary conditions, were ignored.

title: 8 crore voters, one big fight: Bihar's ballot battle explodes; SIR controversy explained
content: Bihar's political atmosphere is tense as the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls faces strong opposition from the INDIA Bloc, alleging it favours the NDA in the upcoming assembly elections. The opposition has moved the Supreme Court, challenging the revision, citing concerns over timing, exclusionary tactics, and potential misuse of citizenship clauses.

title: Connor McDavid trade chatter: Maple Leafs seen as likely suitor
content: Following the Edmonton Oilers' Stanley Cup Finals defeat, speculations swirl around Connor McDavid's future. Reports suggest a potential move to the Toronto Maple Leafs when his contract ends, uniting Canada's best player with its biggest hockey market. While McDavid remains silent, focusing on family, fans hope for an Oilers resurgence next season.

title: 'He got tired of BBL smell': Fans slam Cardi B after she deletes Stefon Diggs pics
content: Cardi B has sparked breakup rumors with Stefon Diggs by deleting all their photos together from her Instagram. Just weeks after their romantic getaways, including a stay in a French castle, fans noticed the sudden disappearance of Diggs from her social media. A cryptic post from Paris further fueled speculation, leaving fans wondering if the whirlwind romance is over.

title: Travis Kelce picks Super Bowl over wedding plans with Taylor Swift
content: Travis Kelce prioritizes winning another Super Bowl over wedding plans with Taylor Swift, driven by the Chiefs' Super Bowl LIX loss and a statistically disappointing 2024 season. Kelce aims to end his potential final NFL season with a fourth ring, focusing on regaining top form to support Patrick Mahomes and silence critics.

title: Rain brings relief in Delhi-NCR; orange alert issued as temperatures dip, air quality improves
content: Delhi-NCR experienced evening showers, providing relief from the summer heat, as predicted by the IMD, who issued an orange alert for moderate to heavy rainfall. The temperature remained slightly below average, and humidity levels fluctuated throughout the day. The rain also improved the city's air quality, bringing the AQI to a satisfactory level.

title: Ex-NHL enforcer Nick Tarnasky floors drunken man in wild golf-course brawl
content: A recent viral video shows former NHL enforcer Nick Tarnasky physically confronting a drunk man during a heated altercation at a Canadian golf course. After repeated warnings, Tarnasky throws the man into a lake and lands a series of punches when the aggressor returns for more. The incident has sparked widespread attention online.

title: 'Hard way' for Harvard begins: Trump admin slaps university with subpoenas
content: The Trump administration escalated its conflict with Harvard University by issuing subpoenas for data on foreign student misconduct. DHS claims Harvard refused to cooperate with earlier, less forceful requests. Accusations include visa abuse and support for violence, potentially impacting the university's ability to enroll international students, nearly a quarter of its population.

title: Lord's showdown! KL Rahul targets huge career milestone
content: With two previous Test appearances at Lord’s under his belt — where he has scored 152 runs including a century — KL Rahul will be hoping to continue his fine touch and reach the 9000-run landmark at one of cricket’s most historic venues. His recent century — 137 in the first Test at Headingley — reaffirmed his rich vein of form and value to the team.

title: Rishabh Pant reveals the secret behind his stump mic antics
content: The 27-year-old Rishabh Pant, who recently made a buzz with his appearance at Wimbledon, also shared insights on India’s playing XI, how the team overcame the absence of premier pacer Jasprit Bumrah in the second Test, and the strong on-field communication between himself and captain Shubman Gill.

title: Cancer warning signs: Persistent pain in these 5 areas isn’t just muscle strain
content: Persistent pain in areas like the back, abdomen, head, bones, or chest could signal underlying health issues, including cancer. While not all pain indicates a serious condition, ignoring prolonged discomfort can be risky. The article emphasizes the importance of recognizing patterns, such as worsening pain, sleep disruption, or accompanying symptoms like fatigue and weight loss.

title: 'Vedas and Upnishads': Amit Shah shares his post-retirement plans
content: Union home minister Amit Shah revealed his post-retirement plans, focusing on studying Hindu scriptures like the Vedas and Upanishads. He also intends to dedicate his time to natural farming, highlighting its health benefits and ability to boost agricultural productivity. Shah shared his personal experience of increased yields through natural farming methods.

title: Study at Yale, get banned in Russia: How a university landed on Putin’s radar
content: Russia has declared Yale University an "undesirable organization," effectively banning its operations within the country. This action, stemming from accusations of "anti-Russian activities" by Yale's Jackson School, carries severe penalties, including potential imprisonment for individuals associated with the university conducting activities in Russia. This move highlights the increasing entanglement of international education with global power dynamics.

title: Sena MLA slap row: Uddhav claims 'conspiracy' to defame CM Fadnavis
content: Uddhav Thackeray claims a conspiracy exists to defame Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis. This follows an incident where Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad slapped a canteen worker. Gaikwad complained about stale food at the MLAs' hostel in Mumbai. Fadnavis criticized the MLA's actions. Eknath Shinde stated he does not support violence.

title: ‘Laughed at how stupid it was’: Epstein’s brother mocks FBI suicide ruling
content: Mark Epstein has refuted the FBI and DOJ's conclusion that his brother, Jeffrey Epstein, committed suicide, dismissing their findings as "stupid" and indicative of a potential murder. He criticized Kash Patel's assertion of suicide, questioning his expertise. Mark Epstein also highlighted discrepancies in autopsy reports and the unavailability of surveillance footage, further fueling his suspicion of foul play.

title: Rishi Sunak: A journey from banker to Prime Minister to a job at Goldman Sachs
content: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is returning to Goldman Sachs as a senior advisor, marking a full circle in his career. After serving as Prime Minister during a turbulent period, Sunak will now advise on macroeconomic and geopolitical issues. Notably, his earnings will be donated to the Richmond Project, a charity he co-founded.

title: Rajasthan: IAF fighter jet crashes in Churu; both pilots dead
content: An Indian Air Force Jaguar fighter jet crashed in Rajasthan's Churu district on Wednesday, prompting immediate search and rescue operations. The incident occurred near Ratangarh town, as confirmed by defence sources. This marks the second Jaguar crash within three months, following a similar incident in April near Jamnagar, Gujarat, where one pilot died despite ejection attempts.

title: 'England have got plans': Ben Stokes on stopping Shubman Gill
content: Shubman Gill's incredible form, highlighted by twin centuries in the second Test, propelled India to a dominant victory over England, leveling the series 1-1. As Gill aims to continue his stellar run at Lord's, England captain Ben Stokes acknowledges the challenge and reveals Jofra Archer's return to the playing XI, hoping his presence will shift the momentum.

title: Virat Kohli, and Avneet Kaur at the same Wimbledon match
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen at Wimbledon 2025, watching Novak Djokovic defeat Alex de Minaur. Actress Avneet Kaur also attended, sparking online buzz due to a recent social media incident involving Kohli. Kohli addressed the speculation, clarifying it was an algorithmic error, while Djokovic advanced to the quarterfinals.

title: Donald Trump’s fresh tariff warning: 50% on copper, 200% on pharmaceuticals
content: US President Donald Trump is considering significant tariffs, potentially 200% on pharmaceuticals and 50% on copper imports, expanding his trade policies. These measures aim to boost US revenue. India is assessing the impact, with concerns about disrupted exports.

title: ‘Had to answer in my own style’: Sena MLA defends thrashing canteen worker
content: Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad is under scrutiny after allegedly assaulting canteen staff at the Akashwani MLA hostel in Colaba due to being served substandard food. Gaikwad claimed the dal and rice were rotten, leading to his violent outburst, captured in a viral video. This incident adds to Gaikwad's history of controversial behavior and inflammatory remarks.

title: Niti Aayog’s gaffe: Mamata writes to vice chairman for confusing Bengal's map with Bihar's
content: West Bengal's Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticized Niti Aayog for using Bihar's map in a report meant for West Bengal. She termed the error as an insult to the state's identity and questioned the institution's credibility. Banerjee demanded an official apology and immediate correction, highlighting concerns about the reliability of Niti Aayog's work.

title: Earth’s fastest spin: July 9 to be one of shortest days
content: Earth is spinning faster, making July 9, 2025, one of the shortest day since 1960 by 1.3 to 1.6 milliseconds, primarily due to the Moon's alignment. While imperceptible in daily life, this speedup may necessitate a negative leap second in 2029 if the trend continues. Scientists are closely monitoring these changes to refine climate models and satellite navigation.

title: Epstein Files: Why MAGA feels betrayed by Trump
content: Earlier, when President Donald Trump snapped at a reporter, “Are you still talking about Jeffrey Epstein?”, it was a reminder that conspiracy theories may comfort the masses, but they discomfort those in power. Especially when those same theories were once fuel for their rise.

title: Daniel Serafini murder trial; prosecutors expose affair & motive in deadly shooting
content: The Daniel Serafini murder trial in Placer County concluded this Tuesday. Serafini is accused of killing his in-laws in 2021. The prosecution presented evidence including cell phone records and witness testimony. The defense argued lack of direct evidence and questioned witness credibility. The jury, consisting of ten women and two men, now deliberates.

title: Laid & lost: New road vanishes in rain days before inauguration in Rajasthan
content: Heavy rain caused the Katli river to swell in Jhunjhunu district. A newly constructed road connecting Baghwali-Jahaj to NH 52 was washed away. This collapse disconnected Papra and Panchlagi villages. Locals allege substandard materials were used. They demand a high-level investigation and action against those responsible. Villagers insist on expert supervision for future construction to prevent recurrence.

title: European rights court says Moscow broke international law; violated Ukraine, downed flight MH17
content: The European Court of Human Rights held Russia accountable for the MH17 tragedy and rights abuses in Ukraine. The court addressed cases filed by Ukraine and Netherlands related to Moscow's actions since 2014. Despite Russia's expulsion from the Council of Europe, the court asserted its jurisdiction. Volodymyr Zelenskyy has approved plans for a new international court.

title: Countries with best work-life balance: US misses top 10; how did India score?
content: The 2025 Global Life-Work Balance Index reveals that smaller economies often outperform larger ones in supporting employee well-being. New Zealand leads the ranking, excelling in paid leave, healthcare, and safety. The US lags significantly due to limited leave policies and inclusivity, while India faces challenges in healthcare and work-life balance.

title: 'Millions of Abdul Raufs': Ex-Pakistan FM downplays LeT terrorist's funeral photo
content: Former Pakistani foreign minister Hina Rabbani Khar faced scrutiny defending a man identified as LeT leader Hafiz Abdul Rauf, who led funeral prayers for terrorists killed in India's Operation Sindoor. Khar denied his identity, but the interviewer pointed out a matching US Treasury-listed ID number. Khar then claimed the Pakistani army wasn't defending a US-proscribed individual.

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: João Pedro arrives in style, fires Chelsea into final
content: Joo Pedro earns back a huge slice of his £55 million transfer fee against former club Fluminense . the 23-year-old scored twice to help his new club book a place in the final against either real madrid or Paris Saint-Germain . liam delap's side ended the tournament as Brazil's most successful side .

title: ❤️ Tim Tebow and wife welcome their first child
content: daphne Reign Tebow's middle name is inspired by a young girl they admire . "we couldn't be more grateful for the blessing and gift of this new little life," he wrote . the couple announced the birth of their daughter in a joint Instagram post .

title: Reese, Anthony join Gilgeous-Alexander as NBA 2K26 cover stars, release date announced
content: the NBA 2K26 Standard Edition will be available on PC, PS4, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S . the other editions come with advanced access, allowing owners to dive in as early as Aug. 29 . all three athletes stand together on the Leave No Doubt Edition's cover .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at RB, DT and edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . we compiled the results and ranked candidates based on number of top-10 votes, composite average and interviews . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position .

title: Final 2025 MLB draft rankings: Which college ace is No. 1 in our top 250 prospects?
content: I've updated my overall minor league top 100 rankings to make adjustments and remove graduated players so you can see roughly where the top players in the draft would slot on that list . this year's class is highlighted by a group of college left-handed pitchers near the top of the rankings .

title: From A+ to D+: Grading NHL offseasons
content: the compressed offseason is an opportunity for every front office to improve its roster . some general managers need just a few players to remain a top Stanley Cup contender . others need to be a bit more aggressive to raise their club's competitive level .

title: West: Should Minnesota, Houston or any West team scare OKC?
content: Oklahoma City's 2025-26 Eastern Conference race looks wide open due to star injuries . a mass of hopeful contenders must chase down the champion Oklahoma City Thunder . which veteran-laden teams hope to stay sufficiently spry for another deep playoff run?

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Big questions: How can NFL players try out for national teams?
content: flag football is enjoying massive growth in the united states and around the world . the inclusion of flag football in the 2028 summer games could take the sport to unprecedented heights . "it's an incredible honor for any athlete to represent their country in the Olympics," NFL commissioner says .

title: Big 12 pool of draftable quarterbacks runs deep
content: one scout estimates there are more than a dozen college quarterbacks . a third says it's safe to project a "very good year" for quarterbacks in the 2026 draft class . quarterbacks have draftable grades for 2026, double what it normally is .
